spanishExample: ¡No termines esto! Ella seguirá.
englishTranslation: Don’t finish this! She will continue.
vocabIncluded: seguirá: will continue/follow , he/she/it will continue/follow (Seguir, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: ¡Sígame! Sé dónde está el auto negro.
englishTranslation: (Formal) Follow me! I know where the black car is.
vocabIncluded: dónde: adverb meaning "where?" in a question or implied question
sígame: follow me (Seguir formal imperative contraction)

spanishExample: ¡Síganme! Seguiré por este camino.
englishTranslation: (Plural) Follow me! I’ll continue on this path.
vocabIncluded: seguiré: will continue/follow, I will continue/follow (Seguir, future, 1st person)
síganme: follow me (Seguir, plural imperative contraction)

spanishExample: ¡Sígueme! Terminaré la comida pronto.
englishTranslation: Follow me! I’ll finish the food soon.
vocabIncluded: terminaré: will end/finish, I will end/finish (Terminar, future, 1st person)

spanishExample: ¿Terminaste de hablar del libro blanco?
englishTranslation: Did you finish talking about the white book?
vocabIncluded: del: "of the" before a masculine noun
hablar: to speak / to talk (Hablar infinitive)
terminaste: ended/finished, you ended/finished (Terminar, preterite, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Aún seguimos aquí hasta que ella termine la lista.
englishTranslation: We still continue here until she finishes the list.
vocabIncluded: seguimos: continue/follow, we continue/follow (Seguir, present, 1st person plural)
termine: end/finish, he/she/it end/finish (Terminar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Él terminó su trabajo antes, pero yo también terminé.
englishTranslation: He finished his job before, but I also finished.
vocabIncluded: terminé: ended/finished, I ended/finished (Terminar, preterite, 1st person)
terminó: ended/finished, he/she/it ended/finished (Terminar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Ella quiere que yo termine, entonces sigamos.
englishTranslation: She wants me to finish, so let’s continue.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
termine: end/finish, I end/finish (Terminar, subjunctive, 1st person)

spanishExample: Es increíble que haya seguido.
englishTranslation: It’s incredible that she has continued.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: Me siguen hablando como si fuera un idiota.
englishTranslation: They continue talking to me as if I were an idiot.
vocabIncluded: me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")
siguen: continue/follow, they continue/follow (Seguir, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Mi abuelo, mi novia y yo seguiremos hablando.
englishTranslation: My grandfather, my girlfriend, and I will continue talking.
vocabIncluded: seguiremos: will continue/follow, we will continue/follow (Seguir, future, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Mi tía me está siguiendo.
englishTranslation: My aunt is following me.

spanishExample: Mi tío no quiere que sigamos viviendo aquí.
englishTranslation: My uncle doesn’t want us to continue living here.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
sigamos: continue/follow, we continue/follow (Seguir, subjunctive, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: No seas tonto, dime cuando termines esto.
englishTranslation: Don’t be silly(m), tell me when you finish this.
vocabIncluded: termines: end/finish, you end/finish (Terminar, subjunctive, 2nd person)

spanishExample: No seguiste los pasos y ahora no puedes terminar.
englishTranslation: You didn’t follow the steps and now you can’t finish.
vocabIncluded: seguiste: continued/followed, you continued/followed (Seguir, preterite, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Por favor, termina tu trabajo para que puedas ir al juego, es gratis.
englishTranslation: Please, finish your job so you can go to the game, it’s free.
vocabIncluded: al: "to the" before a masculine noun
puedas: "be able", "you be able" (Poder, subjunctive, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Quiere que terminemos para que ella pueda seguir.
englishTranslation: She wants us to finish so that she can continue.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
pueda: "be able", "he/she/it be able" (Poder, subjunctive, 3rd person)
terminemos: end/finish, we end/finish (Terminar, subjunctive, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Quiero que sigas con tu ayuda para que ellos terminen.
englishTranslation: I want you to continue with your help so that they finish.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
sigas: continue/follow, you continue/follow (Seguir, subjunctive, 2nd person)
terminen: end/finish, they end/finish (Terminar, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Seguí a un humano y terminamos aquí.
englishTranslation: I followed a human and we ended up here.
vocabIncluded: "the personal a": using an extra "a" before a direct object when it's a person
seguí: continued/followed, I continued/followed(Seguir, preterite, 1st person)
terminamos: ended/finished, we ended/finished (Terminar, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Seguimos trabajando hasta que terminamos.
englishTranslation: We kept working until we finished.
vocabIncluded: seguimos: continued/followed, we continued/followed (Seguir, preterite, 1st person plural)
terminamos: ended/finished, we ended/finished (Terminar, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Seguirán siendo novios.
englishTranslation: They will continue being boyfriend and girlfriend.
vocabIncluded: seguirán: will continue/follow, they will continue/follow (Seguir, future, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Seguirás con esto hasta que veas a otro animal.
englishTranslation: You’ll continue with this until you see another animal.
vocabIncluded: "the personal a": using an extra "a" before a direct object when it's a person
seguirás: will continue/follow, you will continue/follow (Seguir, future, 2nd person)
veas: see, you see (Ver, subjunctive, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Si ella sigue aquí cuando él siga con su trabajo, será duro.
englishTranslation: If she continues here when he continues with his job, it’ll be hard.
vocabIncluded: será: "will be", "he/she/it will be" (Ser, future, 3rd person)
siga: continue/follow, he/she/it continue/follow (Seguir, subjunctive, 3rd person)
sigue: continues/follows, he/she/it continues/follows (Seguir, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Si no terminan esto ahora no quiero que sigan.
englishTranslation: If they don’t finish this now I don’t want them to continue.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
sigan: continue/follow, they continue/follow (Seguir, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)
terminan: end/finish, they end/finish (Terminar, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Si sigues diciendo eso, la gente va a pensar que eres un asesino.
englishTranslation: If you keep saying that, people will think you’re a murderer.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
sigues: continue/follow, you continue/follow (Seguir, present, 2nd person)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: Si su marido termina el trabajo, puede estar libre.
englishTranslation: If her husband finishes the job, he might be free.
vocabIncluded: termina: ends up/finishes, he/she/it ends up/finishes (Terminar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Si termino esto ahora, quizás no siga.
englishTranslation: If I finish this now, maybe I won’t continue.
vocabIncluded: siga: continue/follow, I continue/follow (Seguir, subjunctive, 1st person)
termino: end/finish, I end/finish (Terminar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Siga hablando con mi abuela, ella es especial.
englishTranslation: (Formal) Keep talking to my grandmother, she is special.

spanishExample: Sigan hablando con él, no es su enemigo.
englishTranslation: (Plural) Keep talking to him, he isn’t your enemy.

spanishExample: Sigo aquí y estoy segura de que ella terminará pronto.
englishTranslation: I continue here and I’m sure(f) she’ll finish soon.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
seguro: adjective meaning "sure" when used with Estar
sigo: continue/follow, I continue/follow (Seguir, present, 1st person)
terminará: will end/finish, he/she/it will end/finish (Terminar, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Sigue trabajando, pero no sigas hablando.
englishTranslation: Keep working, but don’t keep talking.

spanishExample: Terminaron el trabajo, pero no siguieron los pasos.
englishTranslation: They finished the job, but they didn’t follow the steps.
vocabIncluded: siguieron: continued/followed, they continued/followed (Seguir, preterite, 3rd person plural)
terminaron: ended/finished, they ended/finished (Terminar, preterite, 3rd person plural)
